page.title: 17Education; Upton Snodsbury
page.content:
The only school is a Church of England 'first school' at Upton Snodsbury. It takes children up to 9 years of age. There are 38 pupils. Pupils over 9 years old go on to comprehensive schools in Worcester or Pershore. Upton Snodsbury School has a staff of two, the headmistress and one other trained teacher. The school would be closed if numbers drop below 25. The school building is part Victorian and part modern, and is well equipped. It has a very happy atmosphere and when visited children were playing outside in the lunch hour while others were enjoying a recorder lesson.
Some children go to private schools out of the area.
